data.value: is a shorthand for this function.

A location into which the result is stored. If provided, it must have a shape that the inputs broadcast to. If not provided or None, a freshly-allocated array is returned. A tuple (possible only as a keyword argument) must have length equal to the number of outputs.

children.type_: ndarray, None, or tuple of ndarray and None, optional

data.value: This condition is broadcast over the input. At locations where the condition is True, the
array will be set to the ufunc result. Elsewhere, the
array will retain its original value. Note that if an uninitialized
array is created via the default
, locations within it where the condition is False will remain uninitialized.
For other keyword-only arguments, see the
